author: Anonymous Calc
title: Count Test
question: Hi, I read @668 but im having trouble understanding. For example the fold-employee problem 3 from released exam, can I get further explaining please
student_answer:
If I remember right, that problem asks you to do a check-expect counting the number of projects for a given employee..
What worked for me personally is:
 Have the fold-employee template in front of you, and think how you would have to locally define
c1 c2... b1 b2 in the check-expect so that when you call the fold-employee function in that check-expect, you get back the number of projects an employee has.
So for Person E1 you would expect to get 1 project back. Looking at the definition for Person E1, you have to see how you would define the function arguments for fold-employee to count the number of projects E1 has.
Hope that made at least a little sense. Will go a bit more into it if that doesn't help
